remarks: The infimum of a sequence of measurable, real-valued functions is measurable.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2014.)
statement:
mbfinf.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
mbfinf.2 $e |- G = ( x e. A |-> sup ( ran ( n e. Z |-> B ) , RR , `' < ) ) $.
mbfinf.3 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
mbfinf.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. Z ) -> ( x e. A |-> B ) e. MblFn ) $.
mbfinf.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( n e. Z /\ x e. A ) ) -> B e. RR ) $.
mbfinf.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> E. y e. RR A. n e. Z y <_ B ) $.
mbfinf $p |- ( ph -> G e. MblFn ) $.
$d A n x y $.
$d B y $.
$d Z n x y $.
$d n ph x y $.
